result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D. Stoflet was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Possession of Burglarious Tools [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence currently serving

miscConds.notes: $9346.69 to Society Insurance & $2529.40 to Ashley Tavern
No contact with victim(s) unless approved by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Re: Restitution Order

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 11:49 am. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears via telephone, and with Attorney Ryan Moertel via zoom. 

Defendant has waived personal appearance. 
Waiver of Prelim to be filed.  
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to: 
Ct.1>>DRI.
Ct.2>>DRI.
Ct.3>>DRI.
Ct.7>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
Ct.4>>NO CONTEST.
Ct.5>>NO CONTEST.
Ct.6>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 5 years probation, to run CONSECUTIVE to any sentence currently serving; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  No contact with victim(s) unless approved by agent. Pay restitution in the amount of $9346.69 to Society Insurance, and $2529.40 to Ashley Tavern --plus the surcharges.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

COURT grants 195 days credit on each count.
